questiontext.text:
Natural domain

Note that in order to fully describe a function we need both the function rule and a domain. For example, we can specify \(f(x)=x^2\) for \(x\geq 0\). If a domain is not specified, we use the natural domain which is the largest part of the real numbers \(\mathbb{R}\) for which \(f(x)\) is defined. For example the natural domain for \(x^2\) is \(\mathbb{R}\) and the natural domain for \(\frac{1}{x}\) is \(x \not=0\).
